name: places/ChIJrZoDYKZYwokRn-fnEWyG8HA
formattedAddress: 1492 Lexington Ave, New York, NY 10029, USA
adrFormatAddress: 1492 Lexington Ave, New York, NY 10029-7301, USA

originalText.text: Jenny has been our go to dry cleaner for the past two years while we’ve been living on the UES. She’s very thoughtful and energetic. I love how she has handwritten notes that she drops off at my building with my dry cleaning with tips (such as letting me know if the material is not safe to dry clean often). She has also given me tips about tailoring a bridesmaids dress so I feel like I’m always getting a fair price. She goes above and beyond in numerous ways. Highly recommend!

originalText.text: I am so grateful to have Jenny as my dry cleaner. She has an incredible system, which allows her to serve so many in our community at the highest level. Each morning she picks up the laundry from our building (super convenient for Carnegie Hill residents) and each night she can be found working late to get the job done. Not only is she fast, she brings the highest level of care and integrity to her work. She never cuts corners or compromises on quality. I trust her with my clothes without a second thought, knowing they're in the best hands possible.

originalText.text:
The terrible reviews are believable. I called to see if they might be able to do a same day tailoring and the woman who answered kept interrupting me and being incredibly rude. She had the gall to ask at one point how long I’d lived in the city. When I asked why, she retorted ‘You don’t seems like a New Yorker. You are wasting my time.’ Needless to say I took my business elsewhere. Not recommended at all. Local or not.

Update. Since posting my review, two 5-star reviews touting ‘misunderstood’ ‘button fixer’ Jenny appeared on the same day. The priority should be on improving the customer experience not planting fake reviews. This business has it all wrong.

originalText.text:
Jenny is AMAZING.  Don't believe the negative reviews she's a great person and a bit colorful.  All the negative reviews are from people who get offended way too easily or expect some sort of weird customer service coddling.  Jenny is like your aunt who will listen to your life stories and give you advice while taking none of your BS.

On top of that, she has never lost anything or made any mistakes.  When giving her clothes she always goes the extra step to notify you of any additional work she plans to do like noticing loose buttons and whatnot.  Be nice to Jenny and she'll be nice to you.  She will also give you advice on how to maintain your clothes etc... so that they last longer and look better.

originalText.text: Jenny is greatly misunderstood. She’s a bit of a character and doesn’t put up with nonsense so if you are patient and nice she’ll treat you like gold. In my 12 years living in NYC and having had a number of dry cleaners, Jenny is by far the best. I highly recommend this location. She does a great job with the clothes and fixes buttons without asking and without charging you - incredible bonus.
